subject: Ethics
title: The Right to Reproduce
description: Learn The Right to Reproduce in one minute.

hook.text: Should a person with a severe hereditary disease have children who will inherit it?

buildup.text: Reproductive freedom is considered a basic human right in most democracies.

discovery.text: Forced sterilization programs in the 20th century targeted disabled, poor, and minority populations.

twist.text: Over 60,000 Americans were forcibly sterilized before eugenics fell out of favor. The scars remain.

climax.text: Today's debate: can society encourage responsible genetic choices without sliding back into eugenics?

punchline.text: The line between guidance and coercion is thinner than we think.

quiz.question: Why is the history of forced sterilization relevant to reproductive ethics today?
options: It shows that eugenics programs were medically beneficial
It proves genetic diseases should always be prevented
It demonstrates how easily reproductive 'guidance' can become coercion
